definition: a reedy grass (see grass entry 1 sense 2), a stalk of stiff coarse grass
changed by bending out of an originally straight or even condition
different from the normal or usual
examples: … she was so bent that she's probably a woman who ought to be locked up somewhere …
Like to get bent? This hangover beater will help you get back on track.

definition: used as an angry or contemptuous way of dismissing someone's statement, suggestion, etc.
examples: I try to call him the next morning to apologize, but he tells me to get bent.

definition: a strong inclination or interest : bias
a special inclination or capacity : talent

examples: They fool me to the top of my bent.

definition: a transverse framework (as in a bridge) to carry lateral as well as vertical loads
